intro: Fagara cuiabensis, commonly known as the Cuiabá fagara, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its fruits are small berries that contain seeds surrounded by a fleshy pulp. Fagara cuiabensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
